meanings.definition: Using an excessive amount of words in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her wordily written essay was difficult to read.
meanings.sent2: The wordily written report was full of unnecessary details.
meanings.sent3: He wordily explained his simple idea, making everyone confused.
meanings.sent4: The wordily written novel seemed to never end, like a never-ending story.
meanings.sent5: The wordily written instructions were more confusing than helpful.

meanings.definition: In a verbose or long-winded manner.
meanings.sent1: She spoke wordily during her presentation, causing the audience to lose interest.
meanings.sent2: The professor explained the concept wordily, taking up most of the class time.
meanings.sent3: The politician wordily answered the simple question, avoiding a direct response.
meanings.sent4: His speech meandered wordily, like a river flowing slowly through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer argued wordily, trying to confuse the jury with unnecessary details.
